# Free For Alls [(by TerrierDarts)](https://www.twitch.tv/terrierdarts)
## Description
Free-For-Alls (FFA) is a chat point extension that will allow you to run a game, in which all users stake a certain amount of point and the last user standing will take the whole pot. For example if 10 people enter staking 1000 points then the winner will take 10000 points.
## Tutorial

## Import Code
```

```

## Set Up
Once you've imported the code you will recieve 3 `Actions`. You will need to set up 2 triggers, 1 to start the FFA and 1 which will allow people to join the FFA. `Free-For-All Start` can be triggered however you want my personal choice is a `Timed Action`. Usually a chat command is best for the `Free-For-All Join`, however what you choose that command to be is upto you. Once you've set them 2 triggers up it's now time to check that the code compiles which it should if not it may need
```
system.core.dll
```

In `Free-For-All Start` and in `Free-For-All End` there is a `Sub-Action` that enables and disables the join trigger, in the case of the code this is a chat command, however if you've chosen to trigger via a channel point you will need make the adjustment however you just need to make sure it's pointing your join trigger.  

Once the code is all compiled and triggers are set-up it now time to look at the customisable settings.
## Settings
|ArgumentName|Purpose|
|---|---|
|`trigger`|This is how a user can join the FFA|
|`length`| This is how long user have to join the FFA|
|`entryCost`| This is how much it costs the join the FFA|
|`fightName`|This allows to change the name of the FFA|
|`potTotal`| This by default is at 0 meaning only the points that get put in will be payed out, but if you set this any higher that will get added to the final prize pot.|
|`ffaOneByOne`| This will determine if you want it to output to chat as people get eliminated 1 by 1. Set to `false` to just reveal the winner.|
